definition: mixed in as part of a community/hiding one's identity/occupying a position while not deserving it
confused/dirty/to mix/muddy/variant of 渾|浑[hun2]
to mix/to mingle/muddled/to drift along/to muddle along/to pass for/to get along with sb/thoughtless/reckless
variant of 跡|迹[ji4]
footprint/mark/trace/vestige/sign/indication/Taiwan pr. [ji1]
variant of 跡|迹[ji4]

sentences.english: Wretched hives of scum and villainy always have the best music.
sentences.chinese: 人渣恶棍混迹的肮脏场所却总有最好的音乐。

sentences.english: Others in the river"s lake worldly life, always has the countless their wicked ways his enemy."
sentences.chinese: 他人在江湖混迹一生，总是结下了数不清的冤孽仇家。

sentences.english: Jackie was running around with all these brilliant people.
sentences.chinese: 杰姬混迹于这些才华横溢的人之间。

sentences.english: We've been hanging out at the same pub for years.
sentences.chinese: 我们混迹于同一间酒吧好几年了。

definition: to hang out together with (derog.)/to mix with
to go through challenging experiences/to become seasoned (in one's profession etc)
to roam about/to wander without a home
old fox/slick customer
confused/dirty/to mix/muddy/variant of 渾|浑[hun2]
to mix/to mingle/muddled/to drift along/to muddle along/to pass for/to get along with sb/thoughtless/reckless
to eke out a living/to live from hand to mouth/to drift aimlessly
to loiter/to hang around/dissolute/licentious
to leave home to make one's way in the world/to leave the life one knows to seek success
lit. dragons and snakes mingle (idiom)/fig. a mix of good people and scumbags
to pose as/to flaunt oneself as/to boast of/to brag
to go on the rampage/to riot/to run amuck
to fight in one place after another
a much-travelled person, well acquainted with the ways of the world
like a fish back in water (idiom); glad to be back in one's proper surroundings
to idle/to waste time
lit. fish and dragons mixed in together (idiom); fig. crooks mixed in with the honest folk
